---
title: "How to connect an RStudio project to a GitHub repository"
---

1.  Create a new RStudio project and check "Create a git repository"

2.  Open GitHub and create a new repository for this project

3.  Navigate to the terminal in RStudio

4.  Make sure you are in the correct working directory "pwd"

5.  Open a terminal

6.  Add the remote repository from GitHub

    ``` bash
    git remote add origin https://github.com/Alex-B-7/howtoGit.git
    ```

7.  Add all of the files

    ``` bash
    git add .
    ```

8.  Make an initial commit

    ``` bash
    git commit -m "Initial commit"
    ```

<!-- -->

9.  Push it to GitHub

    ``` bash
    git push -u origin main
    ```

10. You should now see all of the files in your GitHub repository
